intro: Cyphostemma dhufarense, commonly known as the Socotra cactus, is a unique plant native to the Socotra Archipelago. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Its leaves are modified into spines, reducing water loss in its arid environment. Cyphostemma dhufarense is adapted to survive in extreme conditions, making it a rare and resilient species.
